intro: Ornithogalum indoserotinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-of-Bethlehem, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is adapted to dry conditions and exhibits a short growing season, often flowering during the cooler months. Its ornamental value and unique appearance make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
